intro: Silene heterodonta, commonly known as the heterodonta catchfly, is a flowering plant species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and slightly hairy, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Silene heterodonta is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges.
